ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you would be able to - Have no more than five drinks any time that you have a drink, if you wanted to?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you would be able to - Have no more than three drinks any time that you drink, if you wanted to?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you would be able to - Drink on at least one fewer day per week, if you wanted to?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you would be able to - Stop drinking altogether, if you wanted to?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are at a party with friends?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are depressed?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are bored?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are not relaxed in a social situation?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are stressed?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you are happy?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When you want to feel more confident?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: If you wanted to, how confident are you that you would be able to not drink heavily (more than 5 drinks) - When someone offers to buy you free drinks?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: When you are angry?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: Can you make sure that you do not have more than three drinks on any time that you have a drink?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: Can you make sure that you do not have more than one drink on any time that you have a drink?

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: Can you stop yourself from drinking alcohol at least one day a week?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: Can you stop yourself from drinking alcohol at least two days a week?

ElementDescription: Think about the NEXT 6 MONTHS: Imagine you are in the following situations. How confident are you that you will NOT DRINK HEAVILY (e.g., more than 6 standard drinks) in each situation? Choose only ONE number that best describes your confidence: Can you stop yourself from drinking alcohol at least three days a week?
Notes: 0 = Not at all confident; 50 = Moderately confident; 100 = Very confident

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
Controlled Drinking Self-Efficacy Scale (CDSES) - Total
Notes: Mean of items cdses_mdv_1-20
